docs.lead_paragraph: Senator Barack Obama said Friday that the top priority of the next president should be to create a more lasting and equitable prosperity than achieved by either President Bush or even Bill Clinton.

headline.main: Closing Income Gap Tops Obama’s Agenda for Economic Change

docs.lead_paragraph: If we tried to capture this week's worth of news and events and memorable quotes, you would be forced to read (or give up) way too much.

headline.main: The Week That Keeps On Going

docs.abstract: It's a headlong rush toward Super Tuesday, and yes, the Super Bowl.
docs.snippet: It's a headlong rush toward Super Tuesday, and yes, the Super Bowl.

docs.lead_paragraph: Eight major banks are in talks to bolster the Ambac Financial Group, the troubled bond insurance company, as part of an industrywide rescue being orchestrated by state regulators, people briefed on the negotiations said Friday.

headline.main: 8 Banks in Talks to Rescue Ambac

docs.abstract: Eight major banks are in talks to bolster the Ambac Financial Group, the troubled bond insurance company, as part of an industrywide rescue being orchestrated by state regulators, people briefed on the negotiations said Friday. The banks, which include Citigroup and UBS, are considering injecting capital into Ambac and assuming some of the risks associated [...]

docs.lead_paragraph: The Obama campaign sends out an ugly mailer. Sorry, but this is just destructive -- like the Obama plan, the Clinton plan offers subsidies to lower-income families. And BO himself has conceded that he might have to penalize people who don't buy insurance until they need care. So this is just poisoning the well for health care reform. The politics of hope, indeed.
